WRITING.TITLE: A stranger at my college made me cry today. (X-Post from /r/offmychest
WRITING.TEXT:
I go to a very large state school in the Midwest. I still have no friends whatsoever despite tremendous effort. I was diagnosed with depression and social anxiety about a month ago. Anyway, having no friends I naturally eat by myself. I was eating in the main dining hall today as I usually do, no person sitting within 20 feet of me. Suddenly, a guy starts walking towards me. I started freaking out in my mind. "Surely he isn't coming up to me, he's probably going to walk past me." But he didn't. He shook my hand and introduced himself. My pessimism still persisted: "he's probably going to try to sell me something or sign some dumb petition." But he didn't do that either. He started asking me about what year I was and what I was studying. I couldn't believe what was happening. He told me he was a grad student and somehow we got talking about sports, which is my favorite thing to talk about. We talked about hockey and basketball, and he seemed so interested in what I had to say. I was actually having a conversation about my interests with someone I actually liked. I hadn't had that in so, so, long. After we talked s but longer he had to go. He said he and his buddies play basketball a lot, and I should play with them sometime. So he gave me his number and bid farewell. Right after lunch I went to my room. My roommate was there, but the moment he left I broke down in tears. This person made my month (school year, even) just sby simply initiating a conversation with me. I'm trying to keep myself together as I type this. This man gve me an indescribable amount of hope and happiness today. It reminds me that however depressed and even suicidal I am, somewhere out there there ARE people who want to get to know me. If people see someone eating alone, they feel the person maybe really odd or repulsive. But we just want to be talked to. Even if we are very introverted we still want company and friendship. Thank you, random grad school stranger. Thank you so much.
UPDATE: I just got off the phone with him. I thanked him and We are going to play on Wednesday afternoon.
He ain't ready for that crossover

Very likely. He was just a normal looking guy sitting with a group of guys, so I didn't think he would have had anxiety or depression issues. Then I remembered that I'm a normal person too, so really you can't tell who does or doesn't have emotional issues.
Go for it.
Thank you!!
Keep your head up.

The whole time he was talking to me I kept trying to figure out why he was doing this. I kept thinking he was trying to get me to invest in his business or talk about his role in student government or something. I couldn't be that exciting for him to talk to, why was he doing this? No one just goes up and talks to someone. I finally realized that he was just a nice person. I've been so blinded by depression and anxiety that i didn't think I was interesting enough for anyone to talk to me.

I can kind of relate, I get nervous when I'm on the bus too. But even more than that, when im walking on a busy street I think everyone in their cars is looking at me. It's terrible. When I hear a car honk, I think they're honking at me, and I get startled and scared. Of course they're just beeping at a car in front of them or whatever, it just sucks. What kind of strangers did you talk to? What did you say? Where were you whe you did this? I'm sorry if I'm asking a lot of questions, I just really want advice.
I know it's easy to say "calm down," but for someone who has gone several days without talking to anyone, this is a big deal for me.
I played three different intramural sports. No one just really seemed like taking the next step. I'm sure there's something else I could be doing but it's really hard for me.
You're probably right. I, being about 4-5 years younger, probably looked a lot less intimidating to approach than someone his own age.

No, I am from IL though.
EDIT: I think I now realize that by U of I you meant university of Iowa? Sorry. We call university of illinois u of I also so that's automatically what popped into my head.

Do it. I understand it isn't easy. It doesn't make someone a bad person if they don't do it, just realize it can make a huge impact that people not in the no friends situation don't really understand.

I'm sorry that guy was such a dick. I know from experience that there are so many dicks at this school. That's one of the reasons it's so hard for me to make friends. All I would say is that don't think everyone is like that.
I understand. I'm not expecting to make 5 new best friends, Its just exciting because I never get invited to anything.

Do it! The worst that will happen is someone says, "sorry, I have to go." Or "I just want to eat alone." And the second one has a VERY little chance of happening. You never know, you could make someone's day.
Yeah I seem comfortable enough around him so I'll give it a shot. He is about 5 or so years older than me but maybe this will give me more confidence to put myself out there more socially in general.
I definitely did my usual awkward stuttering at first but after a few minutes it just felt like I was talking to someone I had known for years.
Thank you. It's very frightening to go up to someone and initiate conversation.
Yeah I'm going to call him today. My doctor did put me on an anti-depressant a few weeks ago. We'll see how that goes.

In my experience most people don't actually want to be alone. When people see someone eating by themself, or not going out on weekends, etc, we assume they want to be alone, but it might just be that they have no one to hang out with and they just want to pretend like they choose to be alone so they dont seem embarassed.
Unfortunately it isn't Iowa State. Thank you so much though. I appreciate it.
Guy
